NEIGHBORLY VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years, how many houses were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? How many of these were bachelor's homes?

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors?

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days? Sundays mainly

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Called and visited spontaneously for birthday's or special occasions.

What time of the day did you go, - in the morning and spend the day, or in the afternoon, etc.? Depended on how far the trip would be.

What about meals? Did you stay then not invited beforehand?

How was the invitation to a meal worded when people had come unexpectedly? (That is, was the term "to make polite" used, or was some other expression common?) Invitations usually came in and not for our meal what & place to eat on all its own.

If no meal, what other refreshment might be offered to visitors who had dropped in? Coffee & cake & milk & fruit & nuts always put out for tea & sum of boiled with milk & chips.

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to "look after the places"?

6. Did you ever have "meets" when groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? You shall building for a new neighbor planning her in any old manner.

Tell what you remember about such gatherings, giving dates if possible, telling what the "meets" were for, and how often they occurred.

When necessary to keep a new cotton dancer

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there many parties, whilst drives or dances in homes? Describe.

Third parties - dance - held in homes

Were these more frequent in later years? Give dates.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one home to another at definite times, - every two weeks, once a month, etc.?

1. In the first five years, how many houses were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? How many of these were bachelor's homes? How often did you usually visit neighbors?

2. Did you usually visit on Sundays, or other days? Sundays primarily.

3. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Invitations called "social invitations" or "special occasions."

4. What time of the day did you go? In the morning and around the day, or in the afternoon, etc.? Expanded over the course of the day.

5. Did you stay when not invited beforehand? Yes, never.

6. How was the invitation to a meal worded when people had come unexpectedly? (Note: It was the term to "make polite" used, or was some other expression?)
